CONTENTS.P: Procurement reference: 9048-GPN-49161
Project name: UKT Tirana Water
Country: Albania
Business sector: Municipal and environmental infrastructure
Project ID: 49161
Funding source: EBRD
Type of contract: Services, Works, Goods
Type of notice: General Procurement Notice
Issue date: 5.4.2018
Closing date: 5.4.2019 23:59 PM, local time

Ujësjellës Kanalizime Tiraneë Sh. A. (“UKT” or “Company”), a municipal water company in the City of Tirana, has received the loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development to implement an investment project to finance improvements in the water supply system, more specifically for:
i— construction of a pipeline for transferring water from a water treatment plant to the western part of the city, and
ii— extension of a water treatment plant.
The project, which has a total estimated cost of EUR 19.5 million equivalent, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— construction of new pipeline from Bovilla water treatment plant to Yzberisht,
— expansion of Bovilla water treatment plant,
— PIU Support, procurement and contract supervision,
— FOPIP.
Open tendering for the above contracts is expected to commence in the third quarter of 2018.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of the loan from the European Bank will be subject to the national procurement legislation, as well as procured in line with the bank's procurement policies and rules, edition 2017. As such, procurement procedures will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the purchaser's country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Ujësjellës Kanalizime Tiraneë Sh. A. (“UKT” or “Company”)
ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.BLK_BTX: , Address: UKT SHA, Rruga “5 Maji” Prane Medresese,

Ujësjellës Kanalizime Tiraneë Sh. A. (“UKT” or “Company”), a municipal water company in the City of Tirana, has received the loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development to implement an investment project to finance improvements in the water supply system, more specifically for:
i— construction of a pipeline for transferring water from a water treatment plant to the western part of the city, and
ii— extension of a water treatment plant.
The project, which has a total estimated cost of EUR 19.5 million equivalent, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— construction of new pipeline from Bovilla water treatment plant to Yzberisht,
— expansion of Bovilla water treatment plant,
— PIU Support, procurement and contract supervision,
— FOPIP.
Open tendering for the above contracts is expected to commence in the third quarter of 2018.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of the loan from the European Bank will be subject to the national procurement legislation, as well as procured in line with the bank's procurement policies and rules, edition 2017. As such, procurement procedures will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the purchaser's country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Ujësjellës Kanalizime Tiraneë Sh. A. (“UKT” or “Company”)
ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.BLK_BTX: , Address: UKT SHA, Rruga “5 Maji” Prane Medresese,
